metadata.title: CVE-2023-28160 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
When following a redirect to a publicly accessible web extension file, theURL may have been translated to the actual local path, leaking potentiallysensitive information. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 111.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-28160` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 111.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 111.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 111.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '111.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
mozjs38 package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs52 package in esm-infra/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
